learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an advanced knowledge of physiology and pathophysiology which enables the Nurse Practitioner to critical appraise the findings of clinical assessment.
Critically apply an advanced physiology and pathophysiological knowledge to order and interpret appropriate investigations as required and inform critical decision-making processes.
Apply at an advanced level, an autonomous clinical decision-making process using evidence informed and person-centred options to ensure appropriate differential diagnosis and safe patient outcomes.

Utilise the NP domains of research, leadership and education to apply informed clinical decision-making processes that are culturally safe, inclusive and reflective of the Nurse Practitioner standards of practice.

assessments.due_date:
4/08/2025 - 29/08/2025

Each Monday will see a new topic/question to be discussed in that week.
assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Participation/ Student contribution
assessments.task_description:
All students will be allocated into 1 of the 4 groups: Cardiology / Respiratoy / Endocrine / Neurology.

Cardiology / Respiratory / Endocrine / Neurology group discussions will proceed from Week 2 - Week 5 (4 weeks duration). Students will submit one response per week to their allocated group.

Active participation in online group discussion within your assigned study group around the presented case study (cardiac / respiratory / endocrine / neurology). You are to participate in an asynchronous discussion following the SOAP structure on set topics such as how do you interpret the provided signs and symptoms and what differential diagnosis are you suspecting? with an expectation to justify why you suspect them. The discussion will then flow on to identify what diagnostic interventions you see as relevant and what you will achieve with them. When results are known, the discussion will focus on developing a problem list. The last step is to develop a management plan that addresses the problem list. All discussions will be monitored and moderated by the course coordinator. The agreed management plan has to be presented as a document on the discussion board. You will actively participate in your assigned group activity and discussion, and also read the information from the other group discussion activity.
assessments.submission_guidelines: All courses require students to submit an electronic version of their assignment via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission not accepted due to nature of this group assessment - all entries must be made before the end of the week assigned
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Part A - You are provided with a case study, from the provided information and data you are to critically analyse the information and identify the three most likely differential diagnoses and what test/investigations you would like to order to be able to confirm or exclude your differential diagnoses. You should identify one confirmed diagnosis and also identify a problem list for the specific patient.

Part B - Will require you to develop a holistic management plan for the patient in the case study. 

Within the case study you are asked to demonstrate your clinical decision making processes for the patient and their symptoms. Your responses will provide evidence on how you are developing your critical thinking skills. You will be provided with a marking guide with details of what is required in this assessment item.

Word limit: 2000 words

Font: Times New Roman 12 

Line Spacing: 1.5

Reference system: APA7th 

Header: Student ID (eight digits), course code

Footer: Reference system used, total word count, page number

Turnitin: .doc or .docx
assessments.submission_guidelines: All courses require students to submit an electronic version of their assignment via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be required to demonstrate their ability to differentiate between normal and abnormal assessment findings through an integrative case study. The emphasis will be on the analysis and synthesis of client data for diagnosis and for identification of appropriate nursing and therapeutic interventions.

Students will be required to write up a patient chosen from their clinical setting, describing a full episode of care using the UQ SOAP documentation.

Word limit: 2500 words

Font: Times New Roman 12

Line Spacing: 1.5

Reference system: APA7th 

Header: Student ID (eight digits), course code

Footer: Reference system used, total word count, page number

Turnitin: .doc or .docx
assessments.submission_guidelines: All courses require students to submit an electronic version of their assignment via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
To complete:

Standard 1 - Assess using diagnostic capability

  • Statement 1.3 Applies diagnostic reasoning to formulate diagnoses 

Standard 2 - Plans care and engage others

  • Statement 2.1 Translate and integrate evidence into planning care
  • Statement 2.2 Educate and supports others to enable their active participation in care
  • Statement 2.4 Refers and consult for care decisions to obtain optimal outcomes for the person receiving care

Standard 3 - Prescribes and implements therapeutic interventions

  • Statement 3.2 Maintain relationships with people at the centre of the care
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be completed and submitted within the NP e-portfolio.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: In the case that this assessment item is not completed on time, this will result in an incomplete grade for the course.ﾠ
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Residential School - Mater Hospital, Whitty Building (2 days - 29th & 30th July)

A 2 day joint residential (NURS7242 & NURS7243) will be held on campus at the Mater Hospital, Brisbane.

Dates, times and venue details for the residential school can be found in the NURS7243 public timetable.

Attendance at Residential School is a mandatory requirement for the MNP program.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 4(04 Aug - 24 Aug)
learning_activities.topic:
Respiratory

Throughout this module you will gain an understanding of the pathophysiology of the Respiratory System and the principles applied to diagnostic reasoning within this field. It is assumed you will already have a basic understanding of the Respiratory System and its function.
learning_activities.topic_description: Respiratory Throughout this module you will gain an understanding of the pathophysiology of the Respiratory System and the principles applied to diagnostic reasoning within this field. It is assumed you will already have a basic understanding of the Respiratory System and its function.
